replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. The latest app update includes a number of fixes and enhancements to the Super Why ABC Adventures experience. Please make sure you have V1.6 installed. If you need further assistance please contact us at AndroidApp@pbs.org - thank you!

content: Worked just fine to download on my phone but would not install on my son's nabi tablet...

First I tried clearing the cache then uninstalled and reinstalled the app.  Same thing.  I contacted the developers and rather than downloading the app and testing it out, they wanted me to document each screen that isn't working.  First I can't do that with my toddler around and second they should be able to see from the reviews that everyone is having the same problem, so they should be able to download it to test it out.
replyContent: Thank you for your feedback and helping us to improve this app for everyone! The latest app update, V1.6 includes a number of fixes and enhancements to the Super Why ABC Adventures experience. If you need further assistance please contact us at AndroidApp@pbs.org - thank you!

There are 5 activities geared toward letter recognition, letter sounds, and writing letters.  Appropriate for the PK to K level.  There are also 4 sing along videos (eg. alphabet song) - these are ok but after the first couple times my daughter didn't want to hear them anymore.  In addition there is a map that you decorate with the souvenirs you earn by doing the activities.  My 3 year old (almost 4) says she likes this app, but I personally think there are a few tweaks that would make it better/easier for a toddler. It doesn't really teach reading, at least not in an effective way, so in this regard it could be better.  The app works well in that it doesn't freeze or crash (at least not yet).
If anyone has trouble opening this app, or being told "waiting for wi-fi," disable your CM lock/parental lock that allows access to the internet.

To Potential buyers: please don't repeat my mistake.   To Google : how can I get my money back?

First off, the variety of games is pretty good.  It covers recognizing the alphabet, the sounds the letters make, the alphabet, and the motions needed to draw the letters.  These are all things I want my kids to get assistance with from this app, and it does that well with assistance from their favorite super why characters  I really like that the app doesn't have advertisements (horrible for kids due to them getting tricked, bad websites etc).  I expect no ads from a paid app anyway, so that isn't all that special.  Now some issues/complaints:  - the first time you run the app it spends a lot of time downloading additional content.  It took about 3x as long to download this additional content as to download the asp itself, so based on your connection this could be significant.  - in the alpha pig game, you can press each of the letters before he has explained which letter you're looking for.  My 2.5 year old just mashes all the letters early and eventually gets it right.   Something should change, maybe do not allow answers until he has said the letter you're looking for.  - in the princess mini game the movement is clunky and letters can get behind the word you're on
